data.title: Amazing seafood
data.text:
Picked this place as it looked interesting and was close to our hotel. We got king crab, shrimp and mussels. Everything is served in the bag filled with very flavorful sauce and you are supposed to eat with your hands. Everything was delicious!!!
Note - they ask for mild, medium or spicy sauce. I got mild but it still had a decent kick to it.

data.title: Fantasic Cajun Garlic Wings!!
data.text: At the moment, I was in the mood for chicken wings, and the Stinkin Crawfish did not disappoint! The tall Asian man behind the counter was so nice! I had a Lagunitas IPA while I waited. The wings were perfect! lightly spiced with the perfect amount of garlic, no kissing after these wings!

data.title: For King Crab, you can't do better
data.text: I've had king crab all over the world. This place, Stinkin' Crawfish stands out for generous portions and fresh tasting crab. Flavorful and plentiful, that's what i like. The service is better than average the 3 times i've been there ,(so far).  Cole slaw is one of those dishes i always want to order but you never know if it's going to be "just right". This one is, raisins and all.  The price is very fair and all around blows away the brand name competition.

data.title: Not a lunch spot
data.text:
Since the line at one of our favorite restaurants was too long, we decided to try this place.  When we entered the place, I had a feeling this was not what we had in mind for lunch.  The one server (a young man) was sitting at a table busy working, it seemed he was preparing for dinner although we arrived 10 mins after they opened for lunch.  Since we were the only ones there, I assume this is why it took a while to sit us.

In all fairness, the menu seems to cater to the Mon-Fri lunch crowd while the bulk of it's business seems to be the dinner crowd.  There were flat screen TV's all over and numerous beer ads so I assume at night it can be a lively spot.

We finally settled on two items plus an app and it was simply "something to eat."  Actually, I am not complaining but this place just did not "wow" me.  Maybe it starting with the server covering our table with plastic and my food coming in a bag.  Maybe it ended with the gentlemen next to us who decided to change their order to take out instead of eating off the table.  Whatever did not wow me, the service or lack thereof added to it. Again, it is most likely a whole new ball game in the evening but we won't find out.  The food was cooked fine, it was seasoned good (you get a choice of seasonings), and the portions were fine; the ambience reminded me of being locked in a dark rustic cabin in the valley of mountains.  Maybe the server forgot to turn on some lights.  Incidentally, after he took our order and brought us our drinks, he never returned to our table although we saw him preparing for the next meal....smile

Who, checked on us, brought us the bill, or accepted payment - well, he looked like the cook because because he came out of the kitchen.  

My suggestion is visit this place on a Friday or Sat night with a thirst to quench.

data.title: Great spot for friends to meet and eat in a fun, but relaxed, atmosphere.
data.text: Wonderful little Cajun eatery with fast service, great food, and a friendly atmosphere. We were a group of about ten, and were seated immediately. Our waiter was prompt and patient, carefully explaining the menu choices. We had an age range of about 55 years at our table, and there was something for everyone. Don't forget dessert! Deep fried Oreo cookie a la mode! So good it's probably illegal in some areas.

data.title: The jumbo headless jumbo tiger shrimp are the best
data.text: If you want messy garlicky spicy shrimp, then get the jumbo headless tiger prawns. Add corn and potatoes. Get a free deep fried oreo with ice cream as a free dessert.

data.title: Great seafood
data.text: Love their stinkin special sauce, mussels are awesome, they give you a free dessert love their crab legs. Yummy!!!

data.title: Amazing service, delicious food
data.text: I've previously been to The Boiling Crab which is some what similar to this but we didn't have to wait at all for a table. Our server was very nice and always made sure we had enough lemons and much needed water. Favorite part was the deep fried oreo and ice cream at the end! Thank you again for a wonderful dinner.

data.title: Very yummy!
data.text:
Prepare to get messy here! This is a completely hands on dining experience with bibs and lots of napkins! This was my first time having crawfish EVER! Our waiter was very helpful and nice. He told us which sauce he recommended for first timers and then he described how to crack them open to get the most meat out.

You get to pick your seafood and then a sauce for it to be coated with. We went with the mild sauce and it was amazingly flavorful! You order either half a pound or a pound of your fish (we got half a pound of crawfish and then half a pound of shrimp with corn). They come in bags and you just pick them out, peel, and eat!

To top it off we got free dessert too! A deep fried oreo and a scoop of ice cream!

A very good experience all around!
